newsitem.title: HUNGARY: Human reports rising exports in Q1 1997.
newsitem.headline: Human reports rising exports in Q1 1997.

text.p: Hungarian pharmaceuticals company Human Rt on Monday reported higher sales and after-tax profit for the first quarter of 1997 and said its exports more than doubled from the same period of 1996.

"Exports amounted to 601.8 million forints, more than doubling from the first quarter of last year," Human said in its earnings report, adding that exports of blood products exceeded the proportional part of the annual plan.
In the first three months of 1996 Human's exports reached 292.3 million forints.

Human released its January-March consolidated HAS earnings report this morning and said its operating profit declined to 173.5 million forints from 204.0 million, while its after-tax profit edged up to 205.6 million from 199.6 million. Its net sales rose to 4.033 billion forints from 3.368 billion.
Of its export revenues, Human generated 280 million forints from deliveries to Canada's Novopharm Ltd, its majority owner.
"This (280 million forints) almost equals to exports to Canada in the whole of 1996," it said.
